title: Biden issues executive order restricting US investment in Chinese tech
description: The order will block and regulate high-tech US-based investments in China, increasing tensions between the two nations.

title: Robbie Robertson, leader of Canadian-US group The Band, dies at 80
description: The Band's hits included The Weight, The Night They Drove Old Dixie Down, and collaborations with Bob Dylan.

title: What’s the impact of Niger’s military coup?
description: Coup leaders continue to ignore international calls to reinstate the ousted president.

title: At least two killed in Russian attack on Zaporizhzhia city, Ukraine says
description: Ukrainian officials warn death toll could rise after attack on a residential area on the city in southeast Ukraine.

title: Two dead after Lebanon’s Hezbollah fight with residents of Christian town
description: Fighting began after a Hezbollah truck overturned in the town of Kahaleh, and residents closed roads.

title: Amazon summit calls on developed nations to fulfill climate funding deals
description: Twelve countries, representing the Amazon, Congo Basin and southeast Asia, join pact for rainforest funding.

title: Twitter fined for delay in complying with federal Trump election probe
description: Newly unsealed documents reveal federal investigators sought a search warrant for Donald Trump's Twitter account.

title: Niger coup leaders accuse French forces of destabilising the country
description: Coup leaders say French forces freed 'captured terrorists' and breached airspace ban, as France denies all allegations.

title: India passes data protection bill amid surveillance concerns
description: The new law has drawn criticism from opposition lawmakers and rights groups over the scope of exemptions.

title: Despite multiple crises, Tunisia’s president still has his supporters
description: Economic crisis and political repression have pushed many away, but Saied is still backed by some.

title: US says no framework agreed yet for Israel-Saudi normalisation deal
description: White House says 'still a lot' to discuss as questions swirl around potential deal to normalise Israel-Saudi relations.

title: Operation Lone Star: All you need to know about latest US border flashpoint
description: Critics say Texas policies at US-Mexico border, such as new floating barriers on Rio Grande, put asylum seekers at risk.

title: Syrian reporter and three soldiers killed in roadside bombing: State media
description: SAMA TV reporter Firas al-Ahmed killed in Deraa, near the Jordanian border.

title: Canada says ‘highly probable’ China had role in targeting of lawmaker
description: Canada says an 'information operation' in May on the platform WeChat targeted opposition legislator Michael Chong.

title: Wildfires force evacuations on Hawaii’s Maui as strong winds fan flames
description: US Coast Guard says it rescued a dozen people who fled into the ocean to escape fire and smoky conditions in West Maui.

title: Singer Sixto Rodriguez, subject of Searching for Sugarman, dies at 81
description: US songwriter who was the subject of Oscar-winning documentary Searching for Sugarman has passed away in Detroit.

title: Rahul Gandhi condemns Indian PM Modi over Manipur violence
description: Opposition leader says Modi 'killed Mother India' and accuses government of inaction over ethnic violence in northeast.

title: At least six killed, 12 wounded in targeted Somali bus explosion
description: Somali authorities say the armed group's attack took place on a road between Qoryoley and Marka districts.

title: US nurse and daughter kidnapped in Haiti released: Aid group
description: Release of Alix Dorsainvil and her child comes days after the UN warned of surge in kidnappings of women and children.

title: Germany ends projects in Bosnia’s Serb republic over secessionist moves
description: Move made in protest against Bosnian Serb leader's withdrawal of the autonomous region from state institutions.

title: Norway considers blowing up dam after days of heavy rain, flooding
description: Extreme weather hits the Nordic nation, forcing evacuations as officials race for solutions to avert deluge.

title: At least 27 people found dead in desert after expulsion from Tunisia: Libya
description: Libyan border guards say about 150 asylum seekers cross into Libya every day after being expelled from Tunisia.

title: Former Niger rebel launches anti-coup movement as impasse continues
description: The Council of Resistance for the Republic says it supports ECOWAS's bid to restore constitutional order in Niger.

title: Sebeiba festival: Algeria’s 3,000 year-old tradition
description: Thousands from the Tuareg community flock to the annual Sebeiba festival held in an oasis town deep in the Sahara.

title: Imprisoned and exiled, a Nicaraguan activist rebuilds her life in the US
description: Tamara Davila was one of the 222 Nicaraguan political prisoners sent into exile in the US this year. This is her story.

title: More teams, more upsets: How minnows challenged giants at Women’s World Cup
description: Sceptics said the tournament was not ready to be expanded to a 32-team format, but the results show otherwise.

title: Iran says it has technology to build supersonic missiles amid US tensions
description: Iran is touting the new technology as Washington has sent thousands of troops to regional waters.

title: Nine killed in fire at France holiday home for disabled people
description: Two people remain missing, officials say, after blaze described as a 'tragedy' by President Emmanuel Macron.

title: The ‘hanging libraries’ of Nigeria: How a book drive is exciting pupils
description: The quality of basic education is on a decline in Nigerian public schools. One volunteer book drive wants to halt that.

title: Bahrain prisoners on hunger strike demanding better conditions
description: Bahrain prison inmates are taking part in a hunger strike over conditions in Jaw prison, activists and authorities said.

title: Dozens dead after boat capsizes off Tunisia, four survivors arrive in Italy
description: Four survivors, who were brought to Italy's Lampedusa, say 41 people died off Tunisia where their boat capsized.

title: How al-Bashir and Putin pressed the self-destruct button
description: The RSF and Wagner's rebellions demonstrate how dangerous the mercenary game can be for dictators.

title: Ethiopian forces push Fano fighters from Amhara’s Gondar city
description: Fano rebels have been pushed out of Amhara's second biggest city in breakthrough for Ethiopia's federal forces.

title: What did Amazon nations agree upon at the summit in Brazil?
description: Nations gathered in Belem agreed to a list of environmental policies but fell short on deforestation and oil.

title: Yoga with a furry twist: Mastering the cat pose at studio in Indian capital
description: Kittens weave in and out of rows of people, sometimes even falling asleep on participants, prompting laughter from them.

title: UK announces deal with Turkey to tackle irregular migration
description: The agreement aims to disrupt criminal networks organising 'illegal journeys' to the UK, British interior ministry says.

title: Pakistan national assembly to dissolve for polls without ex-PM Imran Khan
description: The dissolution marks the end of a chaotic tenure which began five years ago with Khan at the helm.

title: How people in Kashmir reacted to Imran Khan’s jail sentence, politics ban
description: Khan, who was PM when Kashmir autonomy was scrapped, has been jailed for three years and barred from politics for five.

title: Five killed in South Africa’s Cape Town amid taxi strike

title: Typhoon Khanun: Thousands without power, flights halted in Japan, S Korea
description: Flights cancelled and trains halted as heavy rains pound southern regions of Japan and South Korea.

title: Israel ‘will return Lebanon to the Stone Age’ if Hezbollah starts a war
description: During a visit to border area, Israel's defence minister said Hezbollah and Lebanon will be 'eroded' if war breaks out.

title: The murders of Indigenous activists mark the death of the planet
description: Amid capitalism’s war on the environment and its defenders, we need Indigenous communities more than ever.

title: Russia deploys feared Chechen unit to police Ukrainian nuclear town
description: Pro-Russia Chechens accused of atrocities are trusted to work near the Zaporizhzhia power plant, Al Jazeera has learned.

title: India women sanitation workers overjoyed after $1.2m lottery win
description: Eleven sanitation workers, who pooled money to buy lottery ticket, win $1.2m jackpot in a big change in their fortunes.

title: More than 30 dead, 18 missing after recent Beijing flooding
description: Some 59,000 homes collapsed and 150,000 others damaged by flooding brought on by record rainfall around China's capital.

title: World’s largest cruise ship prepares to sail as COVID-hit industry rebounds
description: Royal Caribbean's Icon of the Seas is preparing to make its maiden voyage in January 2024.

title: Why ethnic violence in India’s Manipur has been going on for three months
description: The dispute stems from animosity between the state's mainly Hindu Meitei majority and predominantly Christian Kuki-Zo.

title: Deal struck to send second-hand Leopard 1 tanks from Belgium to Ukraine
description: Tanks sold off as obsolete now in demand as Ukraine's Western supporters seek to provide more weapons to fight Russia.

title: Northern Irish police accidentally share names, work location of officers
description: UK's MI5 intelligence agency recently increased threat level in Northern Ireland from 'domestic terrorism' to severe.

title: China’s slips into deflation as prices fall for first time since early 2021
description: China's consumer price index fell by 0.3 percent in July after staying flat the previous month.

title: Canadian rapper Tory Lanez gets 10 years for Megan Thee Stallion shooting
description: Megan Thee Stallion testified that Lanez fired gun at her feet and shouted for her to dance following argument in 2020.

title: Russia shoots down two armed drones headed for Moscow
description: Moscow's mayor says two 'combat drones' shot down in the Domodedovo and Minsk Highway areas while en route to Moscow.

title: Amazon nations launch alliance to protect rainforest at key summit
description: Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Guyana, Peru, Suriname and Venezuela sign declaration to safeguard the Amazon.

title: World Bank halts new loans to Uganda over anti-LGBTQ law
description: The US-based lender says controversial law contradicts its values.
